ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
A very strong grasp of complex grammatical concepts in Russian.
Advanced reading, writing, and listening comprehension.
Motivation and the resources to fortify my oral skills through additional practice.

This course has been very useful in terms of learning grammatical structures within the Russian language. Both of the instructors explained the grammer in ways that made sense, especially considering the entire course was instructed in Russian which was also very useful.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The course is exceptionally well organized (2-1-2-1-2 hours per day with tests 2 times a week, oral exams, and several options for the final project). The professor goes over several key concepts repetitively to drill them into your brain. The homework is helpful.
That being said, the textbook element of the course is slightly painful at times because it is gimmicky, made an excessive amount of mistakes (problematic for student learning), and slowed down the learning.

Some of the exercises in the textbook were a little confusing and at times I thought they didn't help us learn, the necessary grammar that the exercises were intended to teach.

I also think that additional conversation practice would be beneficial either as a group on individual pairs.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If the student comes in with a certain base level understanding of Russian and a limitless desire to learn, absolutely.

I absolutely would recommend this couse to anyone who wants to challenge themselves and increase their capacity to speak Russian. It is a difficult course with lots of homework but I think that level of work ensures the student remains semi-immersed in Russian and greatly increases proficiency.
